availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas Turner (Montgomery Co., KY, State Rep & attorney)

body.p: Montgomery County, Kentucky, attorney, politician, and soldier. Madison County, Kentucky, native. Son of Squire Turner and Elizabeth Turner. Married to Mary B. Everitt Turner on October 25, 1857. Married to Henrietta Robertson Turner on December 31, 1857. Father of Mary E. Turner, Ben Turner, Squire Turner, and Charlie Turner. Graduated from Centre College in Danville, Kentucky, in 1840. Graduated from law school at Transylvania University in Lexington in 1842. Served in the 1st Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment in the U. S.-Mexican War from 1846 to 1848. Attorney in Richmond, Kentucky, in 1850. Attorney in Montgomery County in 1860. Owned nineteen enslaved persons in Montgomery County in 1860. Member of the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from Montgomery County from 1861 to 1863.

ab.bibl:
